column4: Lockheed Martin wins $1.2 billion U.S. defense contract -Pentagon
column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 18 Lockheed Martin Corp  subsidiary Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Co has been awarded a $1.2 billion contract to upgrade F-16 aircraft for South Korea  the Pentagon said on Friday.   Work will be performed at Fort Worth  Texas  and is expected to be complete by Nov. 15  2025  the Pentagon said in a statement.     (Reporting by Eric Walsh; Editing by Eric Beech)

column4: Exclusive: Brazil's Cemig mulls sale of stake in venture with Vale: sources

column4: Brazil judge to hear criminal charges for Samarco dam disaster
